favourite.article: I'm in counseling for food addiction which I believe to be a spiritual issue. I have put my food cravings before God. I need to put God as my first priority, to fill my life, my soul with Him. I have sung this song many times but never in this context. Anyone who has a craving other than God, read this and see if it doesn't speak to you! God can and will feed me and fill me til I want nothing else if I will only let Him. I will let Him!!
This song brought tears from an advanced Alzheimer patient. That is how powerful this song is when the Spirit is involved in it.
I woke up this morn with this beautiful song on my lips. Father in Heaven this day I pray that You fill me till I want no more. My prayer goes out to anyone such person who reads this comment.
This song is so powerful.

I was in prayer this morning talking to the Lord about tomorrow's sermon. This song came back to me from so many years ago. I began to sing it and God's presence just washed over me. Tears began to flow. I never knew the verses just the chorus. I'm preaching on John 4, the woman at the well. Jesus told her if you knew Me you would ask of Me living water! The first verse is about her. Thank You Jesus!

Wow, this brings back such amazing memories of my childhood. It's humbling to feel the power of our GOD who reigns absolute and supreme. We come to Him completely empty and He fills us. Thank You Lord! It's so great to see the comments of other believers. Although we are strangers on earth...we are brothers and sisters in Christ and I so look forward to meeting you all face to face one day in heaven.
I grew knowing this song and so many others. In my worse times I am the women at the well. This is a very powerful song. Thank You my Lord.
This song reminds me of camp meeting in South Africa. It was very powerful. Thank you for this lyrics.
My soul is thirsty for You Lord. I need the infilling of Your Spirit as I go through this journey of life.
God reminded me of this song ths morning. I remember singing it as a young girl at church. How easily it came back. Take my cup Lord, fill it up Lord today I ask.
Blessed by this song. Fill my cup, oh Lord. It reminds me where I first believe.
I sang this with my father in church when I was young. This morning in my quiet time, it came to mind. I searched for the lyrics and found them here. Thank you. It is my heart's cry.
I'm blessed with this song.
Thank You Jesus.
I'm crying if I sing the song.... Thank you for so much for GOD....
The inspiration in this song is so, so powerful.
Thank you for having this song. I only know the chorus, but it is part of my morning prayer service from now on. God bless and keep you and your web site. Thank you.

Early in the morning I was awaken by Holy Spirit with these words in my spirit; fill my cup Lord until I want no more. Without hesitation I search them out and this is what was revealed to me. Thank You so much for Your keeping power.
Amazing!
Great song. Extremely inspiring!

I was introduced to this song forty years ago. It was the favorite of a member of the church my brother pastored. It became my husband's favorite, also. I love to sing it as a special. It is so simple and yet so impactful. I pray that it blesses all who read the words or hear it sung.
I love this song and it's a blessing to my soul, Amen.
Very inspiring. We seek a filling daily fresh oil each day.
Very inspiring. Lets all worship the Lord in truth and our cups shall never go dry. God bless the songwriter, those who uploaded it and all of you here on this page.
Praise the Lord, I pray daily so that the Lord can fill my cup, and cleans me so I can be available for his purpose.
Very good.

My prayer is that the good Lord will fill our cup till it overflows today in Jesus Name. We will never thirst again in Jesus Name. The Lord will quench our thirsting souls in Jesus name. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Shalom!!!
Lord, quench our thirst! Fill our hunger!
lovely

Fill my cup, Lord, to overflow That the whole world may know that of a Truth Your name is Jehovah El-Shaddai. I love this song as it touches my heart each time I hear or sing it. Thank God for the inspiration.
Like this song.
Fill my cup Lord, even if it's just one more time. Joy unspeakable and full of glory
A thank You to God for filling me with His love, peace & understanding.

Woke up this morning with this song! It's been so very long since I've heard this song in our churches! Come and quench this thirsting in my soul! Bread of Heaven feed me till I want no more! Fill my cup Lord, fill it up and make me whole. Come Lord Jesus come!
Love this song. It's good. God is good.

article.author: Nesty
article.provst: San Andres, Providence and Saint Cathline

favourite.article: This is my inspiration today. All I need is to be in the presence of my Heavenly Father. Fill my cup Lord, I need You today more than yesterday and less than tomorrow.
This song just keep picking me up this morning. I am praying that God take control of my life this year in every way. I asking that You just lift me up to that place in God.
I so much love this hymn.

In response to Mr. Olushola, Akoka, Lagos, Nigeria, I am prepared to sing to you or at the same time teach you how to sing the verses of this song "Fill My Cup Lord" just as the notes are scored. You can call me on [hidden], as am very close to you in Lagos. Just to give you necessary assurance, I am someone you must have met years back through a TV performances with Funmi Iyanda. Hoping to see you soonest. Thanks.

Thank you, Vee, for your encouraging and uplifting comments. I completely agree. And to Leslie--better start checking the Word of God instead of Calvin. Your comments on verse 3 of this song show you aren't following the Bible but hyper-Calvinism. Whosoever will may come--as many as receive Him, to them He gives the power (right or privilege) to become the children of God. Leslie, you are right--"The Lord is under no obligation to 'save me' simply because I 'humbly' ask Him to." But He will--because He has offered by grace to saved those who call upon the name of the Lord upon believing that Jesus Christ is their personal payment for their sins. We must never add nor take away what God has said in His Word--ESPECIALLY about His offer of salvation by grace through faith.

In reply to Leslie, why do you make such disturbing comments about a song which is simply trying to minister and tell "the sinner" how to get to God? In 2 Chronicles 7:14 says "if my people who are called by my name will HUMBLE themselves and PRAY........ I know there are more requirements, but this is a song to encourage you to get to know God, not a Bible study moment. How did you get from commenting on the lyrics of a song to spouting what looks like condemnation. Simply listening to the words with a contrite heart will do, follow the instructions, then God and the Holy Spirit will do the rest.
The tone is pleading and tender. Such a sweet song. A precious song I remember from my childhood growing up in the Methodist Church.
I was only looking for the 'Fill my cup' not knowing that it has verses, please can anyone help me to send the tone of the verses to me.
Thanks for posting this song. I was looking for the real and complete lyrics that I can't find anywhere. God bless your ministry!
Oh Lord please come and quench this thirsting of my soul!
Awesome words of comfort & assurance of all God's promises. Fill it up Lord!
I feel blessed this Sabbath, this song just gets me closer to God above, Happy sabbath.

The first two verses are great. They are a prayer. The last verse is simply NOT TRUE, and very deceptive. The Lord is under no obligation to "save me" simply because I "humbly" ask him to. The first verse shows the picture of TRUE conversion. "I heard my Savior speaking, 'Draw from the well that never will run dry.'" The Lord is the initiator, 'lest any man boast.' Jesus "must needs go through Samaria" because the Lord WILL save the elect. This event demonstrates that it matters not who you are, or where you are, if you are God's chosen, His 'elect,' He WILL come and get you. Many think they are 'saved' who are not. Jesus said, "Strait is the gate, and narrow is the way, which leadeth unto life: and FEW there be, that find it." Conversely, He said, "WIDE is the gate, and broad is the way that leadeth to destruction: and MANY there be, which go in thereat." Read it in context (Mt. 7:13-27) may the Spirit open to you the fact that most 'professing Christians' are goats and do not know it: "there is no fear of God before their eyes." (Rom. 3:18.) For excellent reading on this subject I strongly recommend two books: "Seeking God: Jonathan Edwards' Evangelism Contrasted with Modern Methodologies," and "Knowing the Heart: Jonathan Edwards on True and False Conversion."

This song's words was given to me beginning of this week, 24.3.2014 by the Lord again after years. It's a very special song, words are a message to me, for in a time like this. Thank you for helping me getting the words through a precious friend of mine who is a user of your page.
A beautiful hymn which I love.

Today since I woke up this song has been into my spirit. Lord fill me come this morning, Bread of heaven feed my soul till I want it NO MORE.
May God bless you all.
Glory be to God.
Fill our cup, Lord!! Feed us, Lord!! We just want You!!!
Lord fill my cup till it is overflow, this new year and make me whole. Amen.
Great song. Only God can make whole.
Yes He is the only One that can fill the emptiness of human soul...Thank You Lord Jesus....
Fill my cup, make me whole, Lord.
How very awesome is this hymn. The Lord brought it to my mind this morning. I thank the Lord for Richard Blanchard, who wrote it.
Fill my cup Lord. You are awesome.
I love God worship.
This song inspires me a lot as far as Jesus is concerned. I like it.

As I was reading the devotional from Words of Hope (Tuesday July 30, 2013- "Water from the Well"-John 4:1-15) the story of Jesus and the Samaritan woman brought this song to mind and it also brought on the tears. I can only say, "Thank You Jesus for Your Living Water!"
I was taught this song in Sunday School. No wonder that I gave my life to Jesus at age thirteen.
Fill my cup, Lord. Come and quench this thirsting of my soul.
I love this song, Fill my cup, Lord. It I s so uplifting. It's my mum's favorite. I have been hearing her singing since I was a child. Now my son is singing Fill my cup, Lord. Praise God always.
The most word of God is preached today in spiritual songs and hymns. Praise God. l thank God for the writer of this song; fill my cup. It's so inspiring. l love it.
Very Inspiring.
It is only when we forget our identity in Christ from creation that we run after things that are made for our pleasure. God bless the writer.
One of my favourite songs. God bless the writer.
Nice song.
I am really blessed by the song. All of this earth cannot satisfy us, yet we continue seeking things that do not satisfy.

I am one of so many millions of people who have sought after the treasures of this world until I realized that no earthly treasure could ever satisfy my soul. I could only find this in JESUS CHRIST, our Lord and Savior. He has quenched many, many thirsting souls!
I will always hold the words of this hymn very dear since it reminds me of how a sinner I came to know Christ.

This hymn has saved my life, It will always remind me of what God did for my family. Like a woman at the well I was seeking for earthly treasures and God really lifted me from the muddy clay and saved me. I know for sure He lives!
God bless the writers of this prayerful song. Each time I listen, I know I still need more of Him.
This piece is a blessing to my soul.
I love this piece. always have, always will. It speaks to me. I will sing this song with Jesus in heaven...

This is an ever refreshing piece that assures the penitent seeker that only in Christ he or she can find a lasting peace. Its my favourite and I appreciate the healing I receive each time I release my faith to connect Heaven. Praise God!
This is one of my favorite songs. It keeps telling me of my need of God.
Each time I listen to this lyrics it moves my spirit and makes me stronger, and also makes me believe in the God that I serve.
Lord, like the woman at the well, I at times long for thing that will never satisfy, fill my cup Lord and quench this thirsting in my soul! Lord spread from my spirit to my mind, emotion and will.
